result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aubrey Finch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aubrey Finch in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Aubrey Finch.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aubrey Finch in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aubrey Finch appeared by video means with Attorney.
Due to defendant's appearance in court by zoom, Court orders stayed bench warrant cancelled. Defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled 07/27/2022 and defense counsel requests a DPA hearing after that date. 
Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aubrey Finch in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for DPA hearing. TAD evaluation to be scheduled by defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court orders case adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing in Branch 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Aubrey Finch in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense advises the Court they are still awaiting an offer and discovery but that this case is in resolution posture and requests a DPA hearing. State confirms DPA is possible. 
Court orders natter adjourned back to Br 37. 
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Aubrey Finch in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 2p
